intro: Streptanthus anceps, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats at high elevations, often in alpine regions. Its flowers are blue to purple and are arranged in racemes, with showy petals that attract pollinators. The species is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native environment.
